Reviews.Title: “Good experience, met our expecations”
Reviews.Author: Jamie R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the busy trains station and is within walking distance of all the sites. We knew we were going to a 3.5 star hotel and I can say that we had a very nice experience. The staff was very helpful, the breakfast was nice and the rooms were adequate. Overall we were quite satisfied and would go back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive service at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: G_M_T_43
Reviews.Content: My son and I have just returned from a few days break in Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Amadeus as they were offering a good deal. When we arrived the reception staff were very friendly and allowed us to check in a little earlier than their advertised time. It turned out that the room we had booked (as part of the offer) was a double room but we had wanted a twin room. The hotel staff said no problem and separated the beds to make the room a twin. The condition of the hotel was excellent and it appeared to be very recently refurbished. Everything was immaculately clean and well looked after. As stated above, the hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful - some of the best I have encountered anywhere in the world. Many thanks to them. Located just 150m from Rome's main (Termini) railway station, it is extremely convenient for all transport needs - metro, buses, hop-on/hop-off bus tours, Leonard-da-Vinci Express (from airport) etc. I will definitely be using this hotel in the future. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - willl definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: cazzy79431
Reviews.Content: We were backpacking so the proximity to the station was a bonus! I was expecting it too be a little rough around the edges as I got such a good price for it but we were over the moon when we arrived! Fantastic friendly receptionists! Our room was on the first floor above a cafe which i was a little worried about as it was a very noisy street too but once the sound proof windows are closed we were very comfortable indeed! Clean and simple bathroom. Tasty breakfast which can be eaten on the roof terrace or in the cafe and served by a lovely Italian lady! There's a small supermarket opposite it aswell which was handy and it's in a great location to walk and find amazing bars and restaurants! Fantastic hotel overall and will definately book again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: solskjaer12
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights and we liked the hotel very much. It is located about a 2 minute walk from the main train station. The room was pretty spacious but was a little dark due to the use of yellow lights. The elevator was very small and would only fit 2 people with luggages. We had to leave our keys each time we left the hotel so it was one less thing to worry about losing. The staff are very friendly and speak pretty decent English, and one of them even remembered us and was ready with our key when we walked into the lobby. You get 2 hours of free wi-fi and anything above that would cost you 1 Euro/hour which is a pretty decent price. We found a loophole in that the 2 hours need not be consecutive, so we just used it sparingly and logged off once we were done each time. We managed to use the 2 hours over the 3 nights that we were there. There is a 2 Euro per person per night tourism fee due at check out.

Reviews.Title: “A good low budget hotel, centrally placed”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover82
Reviews.Content: No frills, no flounces just a clean, comfortable hotel right beside the Termini with links to airport and the two Metro lines. Staff helpful and friendly. Nice breakfast and overall relaxing atmosphere. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: mjmcg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based upon TripAdvisor reviews and its close proximity to Termini. The young man who was working the desk when we arrived was very helpful and pleasant. When a street vendor seriously harrassed my sister and I as we walked outside, the gentleman chased him off and made sure that he did not bother us further. He also suggested several good places for dinner that evening. The rooms were small, but this is not unexpected in Europe. Ours opened to a courtyard and it was soothing to fall asleep to the sounds of a restaurant (talking, dishes clinking, etc. ) Our traveling companion's room opened to the street and they said it was quite noisy, but nothing few earplugs couldn't solve. You might want to request a back of the hotel room, though. The bathroom was very generously sized, with a jacuzzi tub and bidet. They included several complimentary toiletries. Both room and hotel were extremely clean. The night porter was an amusingly crochety older man who didn't speak English, but he taught me how to say our room number in Italian. :) Good breakfast in a pleasant courtyard. Nice hotel in a very convenient area for reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: leicestermancunian
Reviews.Content: A couple of minutes from termini so a doddle to get anywhere. The staff were very helpful, the rooms pleasant although there is quite a lot of traffic noise. Breakfasts basic although I wouldn't expect anything more in most European cities. There are lots of English speaking guests so one thing that would have been nice would be the facility to get just one English speaking news channel on the tv.

Reviews.Title: “very rough, arrogant and and never guest friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: romeCochin
Reviews.Content: The attitude of the staff was very disappointing, rough and arrogant. Even the Director was talking to us as if we were staying there free, and please note we were paying 145 euros per night for such a small room. after evening till morning there is only an old man sits at the reception and he don't know english and treats guests like beggars.For room key also we have to write and give him. they claim they are 3 star and I see that they are not even worth any.Overall my experience here was very bad, spoiled our trip mood entirely

Reviews.Title: “Not Good First Impressions”
Reviews.Author: alanjcherry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at 2200hrs after a 2 and a half hour flight from Newcastle so were looking forward to a good nights sleep. Check in went without fault even though the receptionist could not speak a word of english. We were given the key to what can only be described as a broom closet, to add insult to injury it had twin beds not a double which was asked for. After 30 mins of sign language and 2 phonecalls to an english speaker, a woman arrived with double bed sheets, pushed the 2 beds together an hey presto there was our double bed for the next 3 nights. Breakfast was pointless and should be avoided if possible, fresh orange juice is diluted etc. The hotel has soundproof doors but not soundproof windows so if you are a light sleeper take ear plugs. For the equivalent of £120.00 per night this was money wasted, other rooms maybe fantastic but room 204 should be avoided like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last month i decided to go to rome for a cheap weekend break. I spent ages searching the internet for a nice hotel and found it really difficult. I was pleasently surprised when we found the hotel. Although the area is not exactly uptown it was a brilliant location for those who love sight-seeing and adventure as it is central. The hotel was beautifully clean and tidy. It was really worth the money, more like a four star than a three star. Not or those who get annoyed by slow lifts though! if you don't, then this is the hotel for you! It also has some interesting charcters. My favorite guy was the Roman who can speak english, spanish, french and japanese! that was pretty impressive. Would love to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Amadeus for one night. We arrived into Romes Station at 9am and walked 2 blocks to the hotel. Very convenient to the station. The area can be a little shaddy. The guys working the front desk allowed us to check in at 11am vs 2pm which was nice. At 9am they stored our luggage and allowed us to us a bathroom to freshin up after an overnight flight. The rooms were ok. Not great and not bad. The shower was small but good water. The drain did clog and the shower overflowed. It was very loud outside all night but we experienced that everywhere in Italy. Decent sized room and AC worked great. Breakfast in the morning was fine. Decent little restaurants in the area, but be careful at night. Didnt have any issues but can see that you could. 2 blocks to train station and to both subway lines. Would stay again but only for a night or two. Clean and convenient. Internet cafes everywhere for very cheap, 1 Euro for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and staff. We were 4 people in 2 double rooms, both rooms were really very clean and very well furnished. Well equipped minibar, soundproof rooms. We had one room with shower and the other with bath tube as requested. Breakfast was very good and various. Excellent service. So near to the main station from which we could reach the airport in only 30 min. Two underground lines in 200 mt., buses, tram and the nice 110 open bus that took us to all monuments. Surely excellent location, rooms, staff, breakfast made us spend a wonderful holiday in Rome. We recommend Hotel Amadeus

HotelInfo.Name: Amadeus Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gioberti, 39, 00185 Rome, Italy
